quizzes.title: History Quiz: Knights and Space
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, leader, valentina. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: By the end of the 13th century, knights were required to swear allegiance.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following combinations (astronaut - spacecraft - launch date - landing site) correctly presents the voyage of the first man to travel in space?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yuri Gagarin - Vostok 1 - 1961 - Kazakhstan

questions.question: Pas dArmes was a tournament, in which knights were dared to fight.  If knights refused to fight, they had to leave this behind as a sign of humiliation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spurs

questions.question: The roots of the word knight are connected to cniht, an Old English word meaning this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Page boy

questions.question: How many miles represent a light year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nearly six trillion

questions.question: Valentina Tereshkova was the first woman to fly in space. Her mission took place on June 16, 1963. How long was her flight?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2 days, 22 hours, 50 minutes

questions.question: Ritter is a title similar to that of a Knight, used in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Germany

questions.question: In 1943, General Friedrich Paulus was in charge of the German forces in which area?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Caucasus

questions.question: Don Quixote de la Mancha is a fictional knight from the self-titled novel, written by this author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miguel de Cervantes

questions.question: The  first space tourist was this businessman.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dennis Tito

questions.question: The Army Corps of Polish general Franciszek Kleeberg, that was named Samodzielna Grupa Operacyjna Polesie, capitulated after the Battle of Kock. What is the exact date of this event?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6 October, 1939

questions.question: Originally, any knight could bestow knighthood on a man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: US General Patton, leader of the Third Army was famous for which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: his reckless sense of humour

questions.question: Name the tax, which knights had to pay in order to avoid going to war.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The tax of scutage

questions.question: The first animal launched into space was one of these.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mouse

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Order and Knight
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, title, structure. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The tradition of engagement rings was started by Maximilian of Austria. He gave one such ring to her.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary of Burgundy

questions.question: In order to become a knight nowadays, you would have to be given the title in royal recognition, or to belong to an order. In the UK the knight is styled Sir and the female -- this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dame

questions.question: Where was Napoleon finally defeated on June 18, 1815?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Waterloo

questions.question: What was the French governmental structure until the French Revolution?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Absolute monarchy

questions.question: This organization, established in Paris, 1951, was the predecessor of the European Union.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: European Coal and Steel Community

questions.question: In the Crimean War, France, the United Kingdom, the Kingdom of Sardinia, and the Ottoman Empire fought against what country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Imperial Russia

questions.question: The legends of King Arthur and the Round Table are some of the most famous tales about knights. Who was the head of the table?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nobody

questions.question: The First Word War began after the assassination of what European royal heir?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria

questions.question: Who was the first wife of Napoléon Bonaparte and the first Empress of the French?

options.text: Louise Catherine Eléonore Denuelle de la Plaigne

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joséphine de Beauharnais

questions.question: Name the last Tsar of Russia, who abdicated after the February Revolution of 1917.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nicholas II of Russia

questions.question: What term refers to the competition between Britain, France and Germany over African territory between the 1880s and the beginning of World War I in 1914?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Scramble for Africa

questions.question: Men were first to wear jewels.  They considered them to be this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amulets

questions.question: The Treaty on European Union, that proclaims the creation of the European Union, was signed on February 7, 1992 in this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maastricht

questions.question: This type of pattern is common in traditional Chinese womens clothing.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peony

questions.question: What state succeeded the Austrian Empire in 1867?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Austria-Hungary

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Country and Nation
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, kind, magazine. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1990 the new NC-17 replaced the X movie rating. What does NC stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No Children

questions.question: The first traces of womens underwear were found on this island.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crete

questions.question: The first bra was announced in this fashion magazine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vogue

questions.question: She popularized the mini.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Quant

questions.question: Which country transferred sovereignty of Hong Kong to China in 1997?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great Britain

questions.question: This type of female figure was fashionable in the 20s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Masculine

questions.question: In 1996, TWA Flight 800 exploded and crashed into the Atlantic Ocean shortly after take off, killing all 230 aboard.  The flight was bound from New York to what popular European destination?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paris

questions.question: The Marcel Wave is one of these.

options.text: A fashionable way to shake you head
A way to fold your skirt

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A hair style

questions.question: The first cloned mammal, Dolly, was named after country singer Dolly Parton.  Why?

options.text: Dolly Parton had just released a single named Dolly
Dolly Parton was an outspoken supporter of  stem cell research
Dolly Parton was the embryologists favorite singer

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dolly Parton is famously busty

questions.question: This is a kind of body adornment that Indian women use. It became popular in many countries after Madonna adopted it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bindi

questions.question: What nation, subject of the 1994 Operation Uphold Democracy, is the only nation whose independence was gained as part of a successful slave rebellion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Haiti

questions.question: What city became the capital after the unification of Germany in 1990?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Berlin

questions.question: He created Chanel No. 5 for Coco Chanel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ernest Beaux

questions.question: In 1996 President Clinton was re-elected as the first two-term Democrat since what former US President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin Roosevelt

questions.question: In what movie does the protagonist call the police about the Watergate break-in, invent the smiley, and make millions on Apple Computer stock thinking he has invested in produce?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Forrest Gump

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Space and Accident
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, composers, bondarenko. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the 70s NASA began a project to create a reusable space vehicle and the first Shuttle, Columbia, was launched in 1981. Five years later, on 28 January 1986, Space Shuttle Challenger exploded 73 seconds after launch.   Challenger was the first flight of the TISP program. What does TISP stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teacher In Space Program

questions.question: This was the first space disaster in USSR as well as the first in-flight accident in the history of manned spaceflight. On 23 April 1967 Soyuz 1 was launched, carrying one astronaut. Shortly after, trouble began and Soyuz 1 was deorbited. Due to problems with the parachutes, the sole crew member was killed on his way back, his capsule hitting the ground at high velocity. What was the name of this astronaut?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vladimir Komarov

questions.question: This English Renaissance musician was one of the first composers to write anthems set to English words?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Tallis

questions.question: This was the first accident of its kind in the race for space. On 27 January 1967, the crew of this spacecraft (Virgil I. Gus Grissom, Edward H. White II and  Roger B. Chaffee) were performing a flight simulation on ground.   5:40, a communication failure suddenly occurred and the astronauts began working on it. Unexpectedly, at 6:31 PM, a fire broke out consuming all on-board. What was the name of the mission?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Apollo 1

questions.question: Which church official commissioned Michelangelo, to paint the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel, the residence of the Pope in the Vatican city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pope Julius II

questions.question: The death of Michael J. Adams on-board the X-15-3 rocket plane is internationally recognized as a spaceflight accident.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: On October 24, 1960 a rocket exploded on a launchpad at Baikonur Cosmodrome. Fortunately there were no casualties.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: On 23 March 1961, Valentin Bondarenko was training in a special low pressure chamber filled with pure oxygen. An unexpected occurrence killed Bondarenko, making him the first space related casualty. What caused his death?

options.text: Bondarenko dropped an alcohol soaked cloth onto an electric hotplate
The oxygen in the chamber was suddenly sucked out
The pressure suddenly became too high

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bondarenko dropped an alcohol soaked cloth onto an electric hotplate

questions.question: In 1994, which political party won the majority in the US congress for the first time in 40 years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Republican Party

questions.question: What Mariah Carey and quartet Boyz II Men song remained at the top of the U.S. Billboard Hot 100 for 16 weeks?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One Sweet Day

questions.question: Jacques Cartier, a notable discoverer of the Renaissance period, was the first French explorer to reach Quebec in which year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1534

questions.question: ?n oxygen tank in the service module of Apollo 13 exploded, when the spacecraft was 199,995 miles (321,860 km) away from Earth. However, all crewmembers returned home safely.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: On 1 February Space Shuttle Columbia re-entered Earths atmosphere after completing its 16-day mission.  All vehicle data was lost at 207,135 ft above the Earth at Mach 18.3 (about 12,500 mph) when the Columbia Space Shuttle broke up over north-central Texas.  What nationalities were the 7 brave astronauts on board Columbia?

options.text: Five Americans, one Israeli and one Indian
Four Americans, two Russians and one Israeli

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Five Americans, one Israeli and one Indian

questions.question: The European Space Agency (ECA) had some setbacks too. Two workers died, while inspecting the umbilical mast of the launch pad of Ariane 5. Later,  Luc Celle and  Jean-Claude Dhainaut were reported to have died of asphyxiation, because of a nitrogen leak.  When did this accident take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5 May 1995

questions.question: The Soviets, having lost the race for the Moon, redirected their efforts towards the construction of space stations. They became quite good at this uneasy task, but also experienced a great deal of problems. Due to a fatal malfunction of a valve, all three crew members of this space station died.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Soyuz 11

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Samurai and Renaissance
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, bushido, example. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Renaissance musician was the first composer to use a folk song in mass, a group of songs in honor of God.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guillaume Dufay

questions.question: Every samurai sword had to be tested on the corpse of an animal, before it could be used in battle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which Renaissance mapmaker was the first to make a map of the British Isles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gerardus Mercator

questions.question: Samurai warriors usually carried two swords- a big and a small one. The small one was called wakizashi and was the honour blade of the samurai. He would carry it everywhere and would even sleep with his wakizashi under his pillow.  What was the name of the big sword of the samurai?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Katana

questions.question: Due to the many movies and books, based on stories about honorable samurai warriors, many people have been fascinated by the Japanese culture. This movie of the great film director Akira Kurosawa served as an inspiration for the western A Fistful Of Dollars. It tells the story of a former samurai, involved in a towns gang war.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yojimbo

questions.question: One ceremony was extremely important for every samurai - Genpuku. In this ceremony, a samurai changed his child name to an adult one and received his first swords. Only then the samurai could marry. Genpuku would be held as early as this age.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 12

questions.question: As samurai warriors were supposed to set a good example to those beneath them - they were bound by Bushido, a strict ethic code. Bushido means way of the warrior and one of its central points states that a samurai must be completely loyal towards this person.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His daimyo

questions.question: The statue of David, the first free-standing nude statue since ancient times, was created by the Renaissance sculptor Donatello from what material?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: bronze

questions.question: This Renaissance figure of Polish origin was the first rector of what is today the Vilnius State University.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Piotr Skarga

questions.question: During the 13th century Japan was invaded twice. The first battles caught samurais unprepared and almost wiped them out, but they improved their tactics and saved Japan by building a defensive stone wall and attacking at night. This was the country that tried to conquer Japan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mongolian Empire

questions.question: Commiting suicide by performing seppuku, was the only way for a disgraced samurai to gain his honor once again.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following Renaissance artists wrote I Commentari,a document regarded as the first autobiography of an artist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lorenzo Ghiberti

questions.question: This Italian poet, considered one of the fathers of the Renaissance, is also regarded as the father of alpinism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Petrarch

questions.question: Samurai is a caste of warriors, that came into existence when the Japanese shogunate was formed. The translation of the word samurai is those who serve in close attendance to nobility. Samurai warriors that didnt serve any lord were called this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronin

questions.question: This Renaissance typographer established the Aldine Press, famous for the introduction of the Italics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aldus Manutius

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Japan and Warriors
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, privileges, bailiff. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: At the battle of Hastings (1066) an army of Normans, led by William the Conqueror, defeated the Anglo-Saxon forces. Who actually were Normans?

options.text: A mixture of Dutch, French and Spanish
Vikings who settled in Normandy and spoke French

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vikings who settled in Normandy and spoke French

questions.question: How was land usually divided in the medieval 3-field system?

options.text: One-third of a manors land was cultivated with wheat, one-third with barley or other crop, one-third was left for meadows. Every year the fields were rotated.
Actually there was no 3-field system, land was cultivated at random.
One-third of all farming land in a given country belonged to the crown, one-third to the church, one-third to knights.
One-third of a manors land belonged to the landowner (liege), one-third to the landholder (vassal), one-third to the church.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One-third of a manors land was cultivated with wheat, one-third with barley or other crop, one-third was left for meadows. Every year the fields were rotated.

questions.question: Who was a serf in the Middle Ages?

options.text: A farmer who was not free

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A farmer who was not free

questions.question: Which language was the medieval lingua franca?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Latin

questions.question: 1867 was the year of the resignation of the last shogun. The emperor became once again the leader of Japan and in 1871 the privileges of the Samurai caste were taken away. This caused many social problems, because samurai warriors represented nearly 8% of the population of Japan at that time. What was the name of this famous, last shogun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tokugawa Yoshinobu

questions.question: In the Middle Ages, the most commonly used monetary system was based on Livre, Sou and Dernier. Which relation between them is correct?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1l = 20s = 240d

questions.question: Although their privileges were abolished, these noble warriors were still determined to protect Japan from becoming dependent on the Western World. In 1877, the rebellious samurai gathered under the command of Saigo Takamori. Their weaponry was inferior and their army was highly outnumbered, but they didnt give up. They suffered many casualties and the last survivors fought to death in this battle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Battle of Shiroyama

questions.question: Who was a bailiff in the Middle Ages?

options.text: A sheriff, responsible for collecting taxes
A person who was not able to pay his/her debts
A person appointed by a landholder to manage the village, fields and livestock

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A person appointed by a landholder to manage the village, fields and livestock

questions.question: Samurai warriors were not just regular men- they were aristocrats, who developed their own culture. In the 14th century their education began to include flower arrangements..
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who or what was a medieval fief?

options.text: A vassal who had his vassals

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Land held by a vassal

questions.question: Who would typically own a 100-acre piece of land during medieval times?

options.text: A poor knight or a wealthy free peasant

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A poor knight or a wealthy free peasant

questions.question: Which medieval unit of volume is the largest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tun

questions.question: Which language was NOT commonly spoken by inhabitants of the Holy Roman Empire during the Middle Ages?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spanish

questions.question: Which animals were better for medieval farming?

options.text: Oxen, as they are stronger than horses
Horses, as they are faster than oxen
People in the Middle Ages did not know how to use animals in farming.
None is better than the other, both oxen and horses were used

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None is better than the other, both oxen and horses were used

questions.question: The decline of samurai warriors began in this period of Japanese history. Even though they were still allowed to carry their swords and could behead any commoner not willing to pay proper respect, they were no longer warriors. Samurai became bureaucrats and administrators, because there were no wars to fight and no rebellions to suppress.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edo Period
